text:
Situation A. Student Claims

Sara came up with a formula for the area of the circle in the Initial Challenge. Examine the formula and answer the questions.

Sara’s Formula

I wrote a formula for the area of the new shape which is a parallelogram. The area of the parallelogram is the same as the circle.

A = 1⁄2 C(r)

or

A = 1⁄2 (πd)(r)
1. Does the formula give the same area for radius 6 centimeters compared to what you found in the Initial Challenge?

Yes, give approximately 9.42 square centimeters.

Sara: 1⁄2 • π • 12 • 6 = 36 • π ≈ 9.42.
2. Would the formula work for all values of r? Why or why not?

Yes. Regardless of the value of r, d means 2 • r.

In Sara’s Formula, 1/2 • πx • d • r = 1/2 • π • 2r • r = πr2, which is same as Evan’s Formula.
3. How would the accuracy of your answer change if you cut the pizza into more slices?
If you cut the pizza into more slices, then the parallelogram looks closer to a rectangle. That means the height of the parallelogram is close to the radius of the circle.

Situation B. Using Circles to Solve Problems

Each of the following design activities involve circles. For each design, answer the questions.

Designing Star’s Dog Pen

  1. Suppose you have 12 meters of fencing to make a pen for your dog. Which shape, a square or circle, would give more area? Explain.

1. A circle will give more area.

If you make a square using 12 meters of fencing, each side of the square will be 3 meters. Then its area will be 3×3 = 9 square meters.

If you make a circle, the circumference of the circle is 12 meters. It means that the diameter of the circle will be about 12/ π ≈3.82 meters. This would be a radius of ≈1.91 meters. Then, the area of the circle will be π×1.91×1.91 ≈ 11.46 square meters.

Designing a Living Room Floor

Nevin’s living room floor is a square 20 feet by 20 feet that is covered with wood. They have carpeted a quarter-circle region as shown.

  1. What is the area of the uncovered wood, to the nearest square foot?
  2. A 1-quart can of floor wax covers 125 square feet of wood flooring. How many cans or parts of cans of floor wax are needed to wax the uncovered wood?
  3. A special finishing trim was placed along the curved edge of the carpet. How much trim, to the nearest tenth of a foot, was needed?
1. What is the area of the uncovered wood, to the nearest square foot?

86 ft2. The uncovered wood area is outside of a quarter-circle and inside of the square. The area of the square is 20×20=400. Because the area of a circle that has the radius of 20 is π×20×20 = π×400 ≈ 1,256. Then the area of a quarter-circle will be ¼ × 1,256 = 314. Thus, the uncovered wood area will be 400-314=86.
2. A 1-quart can of floor wax covers 125 square feet of wood flooring. How many cans or parts of cans of floor wax are needed to wax the uncovered wood?

About 0.7 quart. To cover 86 ft2, you will need less than one can. 86 is about less than 70% of 125 (125 x 0.7 = 87.5), you need 70% of a can, which is about 0.7quart. Or, you can find the ratio by dividing 86 by 125, which is 0.688. Then you need 0.688 quart of floor wax.
3. A special finishing trim was placed along the curved edge of the carpet. How much trim, to the nearest tenth of a foot, was needed?

31.4 ft. The curved edge is part of a circle and the circumference of the circle is π×2x20 = π×40 ≈ 125.6. Since the trim goes along the edge of a quarter-circle, you need ¼ of the circumference. ¼ × 125.6 = 31.4.

Designing and Pricing Pizzas

A pizzeria plans to sell three sizes of its new pizza with cheese in the crust. A small pizza will be 9 inches in diameter, a medium will be 12 inches in diameter, and a large will be 15inches in diameter. The owner found that $6 was a fair price for a 9-inch pizza with one topping. Based on this price, she wants to find fair prices for 12- and 15-inch pizzas with one topping.

1. What prices would you suggest for the larger pizzas? Explain your reasoning.

$11 for a medium pizza and $17 for a large pizza. The pizza price depends on its size. A bigger pizza costs more than smaller one. You can compare the areas of three pizzas. The ratio of the area of small pizza to its price is 63.59 ÷ 6 ≈ 10.6. Using this ratio, you can find the price for the medium and large pizzas. For the medium one, 113.04 ÷ 10.6 ≈10.66; for the large one, 176.63 ÷ 10.6 ≈ 16.66.

Designing Social Distancing Circles

During a recent COVID-19 pandemic, a local park is marking 6 foot diameter circles for families to gather to watch an outdoor movie. The circles are also six feet apart. If the area of the park is 6400 square feet, create a design that the park manager can use to layout the circles.

1. How many circles did you create?
Answers will vary. Possible answers include:
